cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 80 miles east of Chetumal, Mexico, just off the east coast of the Yucatan Peninsula
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north through the Yucatan Channel, strengthen over the east-central Gulf of Mexico, then curve northeastward across the southeast U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic late in the 5-day period.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect from Tulum to Cabo Catoche, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and the Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected along the Florida Panhandle and then inland across the southeastern United States
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (probable totals 1â€“2 in. as remnant system passes)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force gusts late Thursday into Friday; otherwise breezy conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Massachusetts coast from this system.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to locally heavy rain possible late Thursday/Friday with the remnant low, but widespread flooding not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous small-craft conditions offshore when the remnant system passes.
